meanings.definition: To refuse to buy, use, or participate in something as a way of protesting or expressing disapproval.
meanings.sent1: The students decided to boycott the cafeteria food to show they were unhappy.
meanings.sent2: Many people boycott products that are harmful to the environment.
meanings.sent3: The idea of boycotting vegetables made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: She boycotted negativity like it was a bad movie.
meanings.sent5: The community's boycott of the new store spread quickly.
